result.execSummary:
The defendant Dawn M. Meredith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: All Financial obligations shall be paid to the Clerk of Courts within 60 days unless a payment plan is established.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Pam Knapp appears for the Dodge County Clerk of Courts office.  Defendant does not appear.  Request to convert amounts owing to civil judgment and turn over to state collections.  Court grants.
Payment hearing on December 22, 2016 at 08:45 am.

Per post office card
ADDRESS INFO for Dawn M. Meredith
Current: P.O. Box 561, Beaver Dam, WI 53916 United States  (Effective: 08-11-2016)
Prior: W9806 Cth G, Beaver Dam, WI 53916
Payment plan granted in the amount of $20 per month commencing on 8/1 until paid in full

Attorney Jaclyn Shelton appeared. Defendant Dawn M. Meredith not in court. Prosecuting Atty Robert G. Barrington appeared for State of Wisconsin. Atty Shelton heard, anticipated def would be here today. Court reviews case. Atty Shelton heard. Atty Barrington heard, requests warrant and bond forfeited. Court heard auth warrant but stayed to jail call on 7-14-16. Def Dawn Meredith now appears in court. Court quashes warrant. Recess 10:36am. Recalled 10:43am.  Dawn M. Merdith now appears in court with Attorney Shelton. Attorney Barrington appears for the State of WI. Court reviews charges, penalties and PQ&WOR. Def pleads NC to Dom. DC. Court heard finds factual basis, finds plea made FV&K, accepts plea and finds def guilty of Dom. DC. Atty Barrington heard. Atty Shelton heard. Def makes statement. Court heard and imposes sent of:

$100 Fine + Costs to be paid by payment plan
DNA Sample
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 12, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Jury trial on July 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.
(3:35) Defendant Dawn M. Meredith in court with attorney Jaclyn R. Shelton.  Robert G. Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Shelton heard on status - JT remain; JT remain; bond cont.

Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore and taken in accordance with prescription) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.

Defendant Dawn M. Meredith appeared by video means w/Atty Greg Vollan; def eligible for SPD services. Prosecuting Atty James T. Sempf appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Court finds probable cause. Court enters Not Guilty plea. RD & JT set. Court sets $350.00 PA bond with conditions:  Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore and taken in accordance with prescription) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Return date scheduled for April 4, 2016 at 03:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for May 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.
